00070 static int
00071 check_is_file (const char *name)
00072 {
00073   struct stat sb;
00074 
00075   if (stat (name, &sb))
00076     {
00077       return -1;
00078     }
00079   else
00080     {
00081       return (S_ISREG (sb.st_mode));
00082     }
00083 }

00085 
00086 /* Key creation. */
00087 
00101 static int
00102 create_ssh_key (const char *comment, const char *passphrase,
00103                 const char *privpath)
00104 {
00105   gchar *astdout = NULL;
00106   gchar *astderr = NULL;
00107   GError *err = NULL;
00108   gint exit_status = 0;
00109   gchar *dir;
00110   char *command;
00111 
00112   /* Sanity-check essential parameters. */
00113 
00114   if (!comment || comment[0] == '\0')
00115     {
00116       g_debug ("%s: comment must be set", __FUNCTION__);
00117       return -1;
00118     }
00119   if (!passphrase || strlen (passphrase) < 5)
00120     {
00121       g_debug ("%s: password must be longer than 4 characters", __FUNCTION__);
00122       return -1;
00123     }
00124 
00125   /* Sanity check files. */
00126 
00127   dir = g_path_get_dirname (privpath);
00128   if (g_mkdir_with_parents (dir, 0755 /* "rwxr-xr-x" */ ))
00129     {
00130       g_debug ("%s: failed to access %s", __FUNCTION__, dir);
00131       g_free (dir);
00132       return -1;
00133     }
00134   g_free (dir);
00135 
00136   /* Spawn ssh-keygen. */
00137   command = g_strconcat ("ssh-keygen -t rsa -f ", privpath, " -C \"", comment,
00138                          "\" -P \"", passphrase, "\"", NULL);
00139   g_debug ("command: ssh-keygen -t rsa -f %s -C \"%s\" -P \"********\"",
00140            privpath, comment);
00141 
00142   if ((g_spawn_command_line_sync (command, &astdout, &astderr, &exit_status,
00143                                   &err)
00144        == FALSE)
00145       || (WIFEXITED (exit_status) == 0)
00146       || WEXITSTATUS (exit_status))
00147     {
00148       if (err)
00149         {
00150           g_debug ("%s: failed to create private key: %s\n",
00151                    __FUNCTION__, err->message);
00152           g_error_free (err);
00153         }
00154       else
00155         g_debug ("%s: failed to create private key\n", __FUNCTION__);
00156       g_debug ("%s: key-gen failed with %d (WIF %i, WEX %i).\n",
00157                __FUNCTION__, exit_status, WIFEXITED (exit_status),
00158                WEXITSTATUS (exit_status));
00159       g_debug ("%s: stdout: %s", __FUNCTION__, astdout);
00160       g_debug ("%s: stderr: %s", __FUNCTION__, astderr);
00161       g_free (command);
00162       g_free (astdout);
00163       g_free (astderr);
00164       return -1;
00165     }
00166   g_free (command);
00167   g_free (astdout);
00168   g_free (astderr);
00169   return 0;
00170 }
00171 
00181 int
00182 lsc_user_keys_create (const gchar *password,
00183                       gchar **public_key,
00184                       gchar **private_key)
00185 {
00186   GError *error;
00187   gsize length;
00188   char key_dir[] = "/tmp/openvas_key_XXXXXX";
00189   gchar *key_path = NULL, pub_path[2048];
00190   int ret = -1;
00191 
00192   /* Make a directory for the keys. */
00193 
00194   if (mkdtemp (key_dir) == NULL)
00195     return -1;
00196 
00197   /* Create private key. */
00198   key_path = g_build_filename (key_dir, "key", NULL);
00199   if (create_ssh_key ("Key generated by OpenVAS Manager", password, key_path))
00200     goto free_exit;
00201 
00202   error = NULL;
00203   g_file_get_contents (key_path, private_key, &length, &error);
00204   if (error)
00205     {
00206       g_error_free (error);
00207       goto free_exit;
00208     }
00209 
00210   snprintf (pub_path, sizeof (pub_path), "%s.pub", key_path);
00211   g_file_get_contents (pub_path, public_key, &length, &error);
00212   if (error)
00213     {
00214       g_error_free (error);
00215       goto free_exit;
00216     }
00217   ret = 0;
00218  free_exit:
00219 
00220   g_free (key_path);
00221   openvas_file_remove_recurse (key_dir);
00222   return ret;
00223 }

00225 
00226 /* RPM package generation. */
00227 
00236 static const gchar *
00237 get_rpm_generator_path ()
00238 {
00239   static gchar *rpm_generator_path = NULL;
00240 
00241   if (rpm_generator_path == NULL)
00242     {
00243       gchar *path_exec = g_build_filename (OPENVAS_DATA_DIR,
00244                                            "openvas-lsc-rpm-creator.sh",
00245                                            NULL);
00246       if (check_is_file (path_exec) == 0)
00247         {
00248           g_free (path_exec);
00249           return NULL;
00250         }
00251       g_free (path_exec);
00252       rpm_generator_path = g_strdup (OPENVAS_DATA_DIR);
00253     }
00254 
00255   return rpm_generator_path;
00256 }
00257 
00268 static gboolean
00269 lsc_user_rpm_create (const gchar *username,
00270                      const gchar *public_key_path,
00271                      const gchar *to_filename)
00272 {
00273   const gchar *generator_path;
00274   gchar *rpm_path = NULL;
00275   gint exit_status;
00276   gchar *new_pubkey_filename = NULL;
00277   gchar *pubkey_basename = NULL;
00278   gchar **cmd;
00279   char tmpdir[] = "/tmp/lsc_user_rpm_create_XXXXXX";
00280   gboolean success = TRUE;
00281   gchar *standard_out = NULL;
00282   gchar *standard_err = NULL;
00283   gchar *rpmfile;
00284 
00285   generator_path = get_rpm_generator_path ();
00286 
00287   /* Create a temporary directory. */
00288 
00289   g_debug ("%s: create temporary directory", __FUNCTION__);
00290   if (mkdtemp (tmpdir) == NULL)
00291     return FALSE;
00292   g_debug ("%s: temporary directory: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, tmpdir);
00293 
00294   /* Copy the public key into the temporary directory. */
00295 
00296   g_debug ("%s: copy key to temporary directory\n", __FUNCTION__);
00297   pubkey_basename = g_strdup_printf ("%s.pub", username);
00298   new_pubkey_filename = g_build_filename (tmpdir, pubkey_basename, NULL);
00299   if (openvas_file_copy (public_key_path, new_pubkey_filename)
00300       == FALSE)
00301     {
00302       g_debug ("%s: failed to copy key file %s to %s",
00303                __FUNCTION__, public_key_path, new_pubkey_filename);
00304       g_free (pubkey_basename);
00305       g_free (new_pubkey_filename);
00306       return FALSE;
00307     }
00308 
00309   /* Execute create-rpm script with the temporary directory as the
00310    * target and the public key in the temporary directory as the key. */
00311 
00312   g_debug ("%s: Attempting RPM build\n", __FUNCTION__);
00313   cmd = (gchar **) g_malloc (5 * sizeof (gchar *));
00314   cmd[0] = g_strdup ("./openvas-lsc-rpm-creator.sh");
00315   cmd[1] = g_strdup ("--target");
00316   cmd[2] = g_strdup (tmpdir);
00317   cmd[3] = g_build_filename (tmpdir, pubkey_basename, NULL);
00318   cmd[4] = NULL;
00319   g_debug ("%s: Spawning in %s: %s %s %s %s\n",
00320            __FUNCTION__, generator_path, cmd[0], cmd[1], cmd[2], cmd[3]);
00321   if ((g_spawn_sync (generator_path,
00322                      cmd,
00323                      NULL,                  /* Environment. */
00324                      G_SPAWN_SEARCH_PATH,
00325                      NULL,                  /* Setup function. */
00326                      NULL,
00327                      &standard_out,
00328                      &standard_err,
00329                      &exit_status,
00330                      NULL)
00331        == FALSE)
00332       || (WIFEXITED (exit_status) == 0)
00333       || WEXITSTATUS (exit_status))
00334     {
00335       g_debug ("%s: failed to create the rpm: %d (WIF %i, WEX %i)",
00336                __FUNCTION__,
00337                exit_status,
00338                WIFEXITED (exit_status),
00339                WEXITSTATUS (exit_status));
00340       g_debug ("%s: stdout: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_out);
00341       g_debug ("%s: stderr: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_err);
00342       success = FALSE;
00343     }
00344 
00345   g_free (cmd[0]);
00346   g_free (cmd[1]);
00347   g_free (cmd[2]);
00348   g_free (cmd[3]);
00349   g_free (cmd[4]);
00350   g_free (cmd);
00351   g_free (pubkey_basename);
00352   g_free (new_pubkey_filename);
00353   g_free (standard_out);
00354   g_free (standard_err);
00355 
00356   /* Build the filename that the RPM in the temporary directory has,
00357    * for example RPMS/noarch/openvas-lsc-target-example_user-0.5-1.noarch.rpm.
00358    */
00359 
00360   rpmfile = g_strconcat ("openvas-lsc-target-",
00361                          username,
00362                          "-0.5-1.noarch.rpm",
00363                          NULL);
00364   rpm_path = g_build_filename (tmpdir, rpmfile, NULL);
00365   g_debug ("%s: new filename (rpm_path): %s\n", __FUNCTION__, rpm_path);
00366 
00367   /* Move the RPM from the temporary directory to the given destination. */
00368 
00369   if (openvas_file_move (rpm_path, to_filename) == FALSE && success == TRUE)
00370     {
00371       g_debug ("%s: failed to move RPM %s to %s",
00372                __FUNCTION__, rpm_path, to_filename);
00373       success = FALSE;
00374     }
00375 
00376   /* Remove the copy of the public key and the temporary directory. */
00377 
00378   if (openvas_file_remove_recurse (tmpdir) != 0 && success == TRUE)
00379     {
00380       g_debug ("%s: failed to remove temporary directory %s",
00381                __FUNCTION__, tmpdir);
00382       success = FALSE;
00383     }
00384 
00385   g_free (rpm_path);
00386   g_free (rpmfile);
00387 
00388   return success;
00389 }
00390 
00398 static gboolean
00399 alien_found ()
00400 {
00401   static gboolean searched = FALSE;
00402   static gboolean found = FALSE;
00403 
00404   if (searched == FALSE)
00405     {
00406       /* Check if alien is found in path. */
00407       gchar *alien_path = g_find_program_in_path ("alien");
00408       if (alien_path != NULL)
00409         {
00410           found = TRUE;
00411           g_free (alien_path);
00412         }
00413       searched = TRUE;
00414     }
00415 
00416   return found;
00417 }
00418 
00419 /*
00420  * @brief Recreate RPM package.
00421  *
00422  * @param[in]   name         User name.
00423  * @param[in]   public_key   Public key.
00424  * @param[out]  rpm          RPM package.
00425  * @param[out]  rpm_size     Size of RPM package, in bytes.
00426  *
00427  * @return 0 success, -1 error.
00428  */
00429 int
00430 lsc_user_rpm_recreate (const gchar *name, const char *public_key,
00431                        void **rpm, gsize *rpm_size)
00432 {
00433   GError *error;
00434   char rpm_dir[] = "/tmp/rpm_XXXXXX";
00435   char key_dir[] = "/tmp/key_XXXXXX";
00436   gchar *rpm_path, *public_key_path;
00437   int ret = -1;
00438 
00439   if (alien_found () == FALSE)
00440     return -1;
00441 
00442   /* Make a directory for the key. */
00443 
00444   if (mkdtemp (key_dir) == NULL)
00445     return -1;
00446 
00447   /* Write public key to file. */
00448 
00449   error = NULL;
00450   public_key_path = g_build_filename (key_dir, "key.pub", NULL);
00451   g_file_set_contents (public_key_path, public_key, strlen (public_key),
00452                        &error);
00453   if (error)
00454     goto free_exit;
00455 
00456   /* Create RPM package. */
00457 
00458   if (mkdtemp (rpm_dir) == NULL)
00459     goto free_exit;
00460   rpm_path = g_build_filename (rpm_dir, "p.rpm", NULL);
00461   g_debug ("%s: rpm_path: %s", __FUNCTION__, rpm_path);
00462   if (lsc_user_rpm_create (name, public_key_path, rpm_path) == FALSE)
00463     {
00464       g_free (rpm_path);
00465       goto rm_exit;
00466     }
00467 
00468   /* Read the package into memory. */
00469 
00470   error = NULL;
00471   g_file_get_contents (rpm_path, (gchar **) rpm, rpm_size, &error);
00472   g_free (rpm_path);
00473   if (error)
00474     {
00475       g_error_free (error);
00476       goto rm_exit;
00477     }
00478 
00479   /* Return. */
00480 
00481   ret = 0;
00482 
00483  rm_exit:
00484 
00485   openvas_file_remove_recurse (rpm_dir);
00486 
00487  free_exit:
00488 
00489   g_free (public_key_path);
00490 
00491   openvas_file_remove_recurse (key_dir);
00492 
00493   return ret;
00494 }
00495 
00496 
00497 /* Deb generation. */
00498 
00507 static int
00508 execute_alien (const gchar *rpmdir, const gchar *rpmfile)
00509 {
00510   gchar **cmd;
00511   gint exit_status;
00512   int ret = 0;
00513   gchar *standard_out = NULL;
00514   gchar *standard_err = NULL;
00515 
00516   cmd = (gchar **) g_malloc (7 * sizeof (gchar *));
00517 
00518   cmd[0] = g_strdup ("fakeroot");
00519   cmd[1] = g_strdup ("--");
00520   cmd[2] = g_strdup ("alien");
00521   cmd[3] = g_strdup ("--scripts");
00522   cmd[4] = g_strdup ("--keep-version");
00523   cmd[5] = g_strdup (rpmfile);
00524   cmd[6] = NULL;
00525   g_debug ("--- executing alien.\n");
00526   g_debug ("%s: Spawning in %s: %s %s %s %s %s %s\n",
00527            __FUNCTION__,
00528            rpmdir, cmd[0], cmd[1], cmd[2], cmd[3], cmd[4], cmd[5]);
00529   if ((g_spawn_sync (rpmdir,
00530                      cmd,
00531                      NULL,                 /* Environment. */
00532                      G_SPAWN_SEARCH_PATH,
00533                      NULL,                 /* Setup func. */
00534                      NULL,
00535                      &standard_out,
00536                      &standard_err,
00537                      &exit_status,
00538                      NULL) == FALSE)
00539       || (WIFEXITED (exit_status) == 0)
00540       || WEXITSTATUS (exit_status))
00541     {
00542       g_debug ("%s: failed to create the deb: %d (WIF %i, WEX %i)",
00543                __FUNCTION__,
00544                exit_status,
00545                WIFEXITED (exit_status),
00546                WEXITSTATUS (exit_status));
00547       g_debug ("%s: stdout: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_out);
00548       g_debug ("%s: stderr: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_err);
00549       ret = -1;
00550     }
00551 
00552   g_free (cmd[0]);
00553   g_free (cmd[1]);
00554   g_free (cmd[2]);
00555   g_free (cmd[3]);
00556   g_free (cmd[4]);
00557   g_free (cmd[5]);
00558   g_free (cmd[6]);
00559   g_free (cmd);
00560   g_free (standard_out);
00561   g_free (standard_err);
00562 
00563   return ret;
00564 }
00565 
00574 gchar *
00575 lsc_user_deb_create (const gchar *user, const gchar *rpm_file)
00576 {
00577   gchar *dirname = g_path_get_dirname (rpm_file);
00578   gchar *dir = g_strconcat (dirname, "/", NULL);
00579   gchar *basename = g_path_get_basename (rpm_file);
00580   gchar *down_user = g_ascii_strdown (user ? user : "user", -1);
00581   gchar *deb_name = g_strdup_printf ("%s/openvas-lsc-target-%s_0.5-1_all.deb",
00582                                      dirname, down_user);
00583 
00584   g_free (dirname);
00585   g_free (down_user);
00586 
00587   if (execute_alien (dir, basename))
00588     {
00589       g_free (dir);
00590       g_free (basename);
00591       g_free (deb_name);
00592       return NULL;
00593     }
00594 
00595   g_free (dir);
00596   g_free (basename);
00597 
00598   return deb_name;
00599 }
00600 
00601 /*
00602  * @brief Recreate Debian package.
00603  *
00604  * @param[in]   name         User name.
00605  * @param[in]   rpm          RPM package.
00606  * @param[in]   rpm_size     Size of RPM package, in bytes.
00607  * @param[out]  deb          Debian package.
00608  * @param[out]  deb_size     Size of Debian package, in bytes.
00609  *
00610  * @return 0 success, -1 error.
00611  */
00612 int
00613 lsc_user_deb_recreate (const gchar *name, const char *rpm, gsize rpm_size,
00614                        void **deb, gsize *deb_size)
00615 {
00616   GError *error;
00617   char deb_dir[] = "/tmp/deb_XXXXXX";
00618   char rpm_dir[] = "/tmp/rpm_XXXXXX";
00619   gchar *deb_path, *rpm_path;
00620   int ret = -1;
00621 
00622   if (alien_found () == FALSE)
00623     return -1;
00624 
00625   /* Make a directory for the RPM. */
00626 
00627   if (mkdtemp (rpm_dir) == NULL)
00628     return -1;
00629 
00630   /* Write RPM to disk. */
00631 
00632   error = NULL;
00633   rpm_path = g_build_filename (rpm_dir, "p.rpm", NULL);
00634   g_file_set_contents (rpm_path, rpm, rpm_size, &error);
00635   if (error)
00636     goto free_exit;
00637 
00638   /* Create Debian package. */
00639 
00640   if (mkdtemp (deb_dir) == NULL)
00641     goto free_exit;
00642   deb_path = lsc_user_deb_create (name, rpm_path);
00643   if (deb_path == NULL)
00644     goto rm_exit;
00645 
00646   /* Read the package into memory. */
00647 
00648   error = NULL;
00649   g_file_get_contents (deb_path, (gchar **) deb, deb_size, &error);
00650   g_free (deb_path);
00651   if (error)
00652     {
00653       g_error_free (error);
00654       goto rm_exit;
00655     }
00656 
00657   /* Return. */
00658 
00659   ret = 0;
00660 
00661  rm_exit:
00662 
00663   openvas_file_remove_recurse (deb_dir);
00664 
00665  free_exit:
00666 
00667   g_free (rpm_path);
00668 
00669   openvas_file_remove_recurse (rpm_dir);
00670 
00671   return ret;
00672 }
00673 
00674 
00675 /* Exe generation. */
00676 
00687 static int
00688 create_nsis_script (const gchar *script_name, const gchar *package_name,
00689                     const gchar *user_name, const gchar *password)
00690 {
00691   FILE* fd;
00692 
00693   fd = fopen (script_name, "w");
00694   if (fd == NULL)
00695     return -1;
00696 
00697   // Write part about default section
00698   fprintf (fd, "#Installer filename\n");
00699   fprintf (fd, "outfile ");
00700   fprintf (fd, "%s", package_name);
00701   fprintf (fd, "\n\n");
00702 
00703   fprintf (fd, "# Set desktop as install directory\n");
00704   fprintf (fd, "installDir $DESKTOP\n\n");
00705 
00706   fprintf (fd, "# Put some text\n");
00707   fprintf (fd, "BrandingText \"OpenVAS Local Security Checks User\"\n\n");
00708 
00709   // For ms vista installers we need the UAC plugin and use the following lines:
00710   // This requires the user to have the UAC plugin installed and to provide the
00711   // the path to it.
00712   //fprintf (fd, "# Request application privileges for Windows Vista\n");
00713   //fprintf (fd, "RequestExecutionLevel admin\n\n");
00714 
00715   fprintf (fd, "#\n# Default (installer) section.\n#\n");
00716   fprintf (fd, "section\n\n");
00717 
00718   fprintf (fd, "# Define output path\n");
00719   fprintf (fd, "setOutPath $INSTDIR\n\n");
00720 
00721   fprintf (fd, "# Uninstaller name\n");
00722   fprintf (fd, "writeUninstaller $INSTDIR\\openvas_lsc_remove_%s.exe\n\n",
00723            user_name);
00724 
00725   // Need to find localized Administrators group name, create a
00726   // GetAdminGroupName - vb script (Thanks to Thomas Rotter)
00727   fprintf (fd, "# Create Thomas Rotters GetAdminGroupName.vb script\n");
00728   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo Set objWMIService = GetObject($\\\"winmgmts:\\\\.\\root\\cimv2$\\\") > $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\" \"\n");
00729   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo Set colAccounts = objWMIService.ExecQuery ($\\\"Select * From Win32_Group Where SID = 'S-1-5-32-544'$\\\")  >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\"\"\n");
00730   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo For Each objAccount in colAccounts >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\"\"\n");
00731   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo Wscript.Echo objAccount.Name >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\"\"\n");
00732   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo Next >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\"\"\n");
00733   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C cscript //nologo $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\" > $\\\"%%temp%%\\AdminGroupName.txt$\\\"\"\n\n");
00734 
00736   fprintf (fd, "# Create batch script that installs the user\n");
00737   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo Set /P AdminGroupName= ^<$\\\"%%temp%%\\AdminGroupName.txt$\\\" > $\\\"%%temp%%\\AddUser.bat$\\\"\" \n");
00738   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo net user %s %s /add /active:yes >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\AddUser.bat$\\\"\"\n",
00739            user_name,
00740            password);
00741   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C Echo net localgroup %%AdminGroupName%% %%COMPUTERNAME%%\\%s /add >> $\\\"%%temp%%\\AddUser.bat$\\\"\"\n\n",
00742            user_name);
00743 
00744   fprintf (fd, "# Execute AddUser script\n");
00745   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"cmd /C $\\\"%%temp%%\\AddUser.bat$\\\"\"\n\n");
00746 
00747   // Remove up temporary files for localized Administrators group names
00748   fprintf (fd, "# Remove temporary files for localized admin group names\n");
00749   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"del $\\\"%%temp%%\\AdminGroupName.txt$\\\"\"\n");
00750   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"del $\\\"%%temp%%\\GetAdminGroupName.vbs$\\\"\"\n\n");
00751   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"del $\\\"%%temp%%\\AddUser.bat$\\\"\"\n\n");
00752 
00754   fprintf (fd, "# Display message that everything seems to be fine\n");
00755   fprintf (fd, "messageBox MB_OK \"A user has been added. An uninstaller is placed on your Desktop.\"\n\n");
00756 
00757   fprintf (fd, "# Default (install) section end\n");
00758   fprintf (fd, "sectionEnd\n\n");
00759 
00760   // Write part about uninstall section
00761   fprintf (fd, "#\n# Uninstaller section.\n#\n");
00762   fprintf (fd, "section \"Uninstall\"\n\n");
00763 
00764   fprintf (fd, "# Run cmd to remove user\n");
00765   fprintf (fd, "ExecWait \"net user %s /delete\"\n\n",
00766            user_name);
00767 
00769   fprintf (fd, "# Unistaller should remove itself (from desktop/installdir)\n\n");
00770 
00771   fprintf (fd, "# Display message that everything seems to be fine\n");
00772   fprintf (fd, "messageBox MB_OK \"A user has been removed. You can now savely remmove the uninstaller from your Desktop.\"\n\n");
00773 
00774   fprintf (fd, "# Uninstaller section end\n");
00775   fprintf (fd, "sectionEnd\n\n");
00776 
00777   if (fclose (fd))
00778     return -1;
00779 
00780   return 0;
00781 }
00782 
00792 static int
00793 execute_makensis (const gchar *nsis_script)
00794 {
00795   gchar *dirname = g_path_get_dirname (nsis_script);
00796   gchar **cmd;
00797   gint exit_status;
00798   int ret = 0;
00799   gchar *standard_out = NULL;
00800   gchar *standard_err = NULL;
00801 
00802   cmd = (gchar **) g_malloc (3 * sizeof (gchar *));
00803 
00804   cmd[0] = g_strdup ("makensis");
00805   cmd[1] = g_strdup (nsis_script);
00806   cmd[2] = NULL;
00807   g_debug ("--- executing makensis.\n");
00808   g_debug ("%s: Spawning in %s: %s %s\n",
00809            __FUNCTION__,
00810            dirname, cmd[0], cmd[1]);
00811   if ((g_spawn_sync (dirname,
00812                      cmd,
00813                      NULL,                 /* Environment. */
00814                      G_SPAWN_SEARCH_PATH,
00815                      NULL,                 /* Setup func. */
00816                      NULL,
00817                      &standard_out,
00818                      &standard_err,
00819                      &exit_status,
00820                      NULL) == FALSE)
00821       || (WIFEXITED (exit_status) == 0)
00822       || WEXITSTATUS (exit_status))
00823     {
00824       g_debug ("%s: failed to create the exe: %d (WIF %i, WEX %i)",
00825                __FUNCTION__,
00826                exit_status,
00827                WIFEXITED (exit_status),
00828                WEXITSTATUS (exit_status));
00829       g_debug ("%s: stdout: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_out);
00830       g_debug ("%s: stderr: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, standard_err);
00831       ret = -1;
00832     }
00833 
00834   g_free (cmd[0]);
00835   g_free (cmd[1]);
00836   g_free (cmd);
00837   g_free (dirname);
00838   g_free (standard_out);
00839   g_free (standard_err);
00840 
00841   return ret;
00842 }
00843 
00853 static int
00854 lsc_user_exe_create (const gchar *user_name, const gchar *password,
00855                      const gchar *to_filename)
00856 {
00857   gchar *dirname = g_path_get_dirname (to_filename);
00858   gchar *nsis_script = g_build_filename (dirname, "p.nsis", NULL);
00859 
00860   g_free (dirname);
00861 
00862   if (create_nsis_script (nsis_script, to_filename, user_name, password))
00863     {
00864       g_free (nsis_script);
00865       return -1;
00866     }
00867 
00868   if (execute_makensis (nsis_script))
00869     {
00870       g_free (nsis_script);
00871       return -1;
00872     }
00873 
00874   g_free (nsis_script);
00875   return 0;
00876 }
00877 
00878 /*
00879  * @brief Recreate NSIS package.
00880  *
00881  * @param[in]   name         User name.
00882  * @param[in]   password     Password.
00883  * @param[out]  exe          NSIS package.
00884  * @param[out]  exe_size     Size of NSIS package, in bytes.
00885  *
00886  * @return 0 success, -1 error.
00887  */
00888 int
00889 lsc_user_exe_recreate (const gchar *name, const gchar *password,
00890                        void **exe, gsize *exe_size)
00891 {
00892   GError *error;
00893   char exe_dir[] = "/tmp/exe_XXXXXX";
00894   gchar *exe_path;
00895   int ret = -1;
00896 
00897   if (alien_found () == FALSE)
00898     return -1;
00899 
00900   /* Create NSIS package. */
00901 
00902   if (mkdtemp (exe_dir) == NULL)
00903     return -1;
00904   exe_path = g_build_filename (exe_dir, "p.nsis", NULL);
00905   if (lsc_user_exe_create (name, password, exe_path))
00906     goto rm_exit;
00907 
00908   /* Read the package into memory. */
00909 
00910   error = NULL;
00911   g_file_get_contents (exe_path, (gchar **) exe, exe_size, &error);
00912   if (error)
00913     {
00914       g_error_free (error);
00915       goto rm_exit;
00916     }
00917 
00918   /* Return. */
00919 
00920   ret = 0;
00921 
00922  rm_exit:
00923 
00924   openvas_file_remove_recurse (exe_dir);
00925 
00926   g_free (exe_path);
00927 
00928   return ret;
00929 }
